item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 24, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Cerebrum: What if we could recreate your brain? (17 points | 7 comments)

3. AIs Will Increasingly Fake Alignment (81 points | 79 comments)

6. What would it take to add refinement types to Rust? (29 points | 7 comments)

14. Why are cancer guidelines stuck in PDFs? (230 points | 107 comments)

19. Automating the search for artificial life with foundation models (134 points | 30 comments)
20. Demystifying Debuggers, Part 2: The Anatomy of a Running Program (141 points | 19 comments)

22. Ask HN: Programmers who don't use autocomplete/LSP, how do you do it? (200 points | 425 comments)
23. More men are addicted to the 'crack cocaine' of the stock market (142 points | 274 comments)

26. My Colleague Julius (404 points | 87 comments)
27. Symbolic Execution by Overloading __bool__ (59 points | 8 comments)
28. Xerox to acquire Lexmark (244 points | 210 comments)
29. National Cryptologic Museum (NSA/CSS) New Temporary Exhibit on Project Stargate (57 points | 25 comments)
30. Physicists measure quantum geometry for first time (43 points | 9 comments)
